pages.text: Kulindadromeus was a basal neornithischian from the Middle Jurassic of eastern Russia. This roughly 1.5 metre long herbivorous dinosaur is significant to the history of palaeontology due to the specimen having been preserved with a covering of protofeathers (except on the tail which was scaly, and on the

lower parts of the legs and arms), implying that they may have been a basal trait to the Ornithischia and possibly even the wider Dinosauria as a whole. Kulindadromeus is also featured on the flag and coat of arms of the Chernyshevsky District, where its fossils were discovered.
